Peru - Dar acceso vial a los pobres de
            zonas rurales

topicv3:
Transport Economics m1326662 162,Rural Roads m1327606 786,Rural Transport m1327164 789,Roads and Highways m1327398 168,Rural Transport Policy and Planning
            m1327586 1827

abstracts.cdata!:
A little over 10 years ago, only
            slightly more than one quarter of Peruvians living in rural
            areas had access to a road in good condition, hampering
            their efforts to get to markets, send their children to
            school, or reach health clinics. International Bank for
            Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) joined Peru's
            government on a program that has rehabilitated 15,000
            kilometers (kms) of roads, creating 6,000 permanent jobs and
            500 microenterprises working on road maintenance.
